description: Either from earlier *sentientia, from Proto-Italic *sentjentjā, equivalent to sentiens (“feeling, perceiving”) +‎ -ia; or from Proto-Italic *sententjā, a remnant of a PIE root aorist.

entries.meaning: a way of thinking, view, opinion
examples: Coordinate terms: opīniō, arbitrātum, auctōritās, cōgitātiō, exīstimātiō
meā (quidem) sententiā ― (at least) in my view
ex animī sententiā ― in my sincere opinion, in all honesty
ex (meā etc.) sententiā ― to someone's liking
adversum, praeter animī sententiam ― against someone's liking
dē suā ūnīus sententiā ― on one's own initiative

entries.meaning: a purpose, intention, will (one's thinking in respect to the future)

definitionGroups.group: (politics) a vote of opinion (expressed in senate in response to an interrogātiō)

entries.meaning: the vote of a juryman or of a jury
(politics) an authoritative decision, pronouncement, judgement, decree
the main drift, substance; spirit of a law (as opposed to letter)

definitionGroups.group: a thought expressed in words; a sense, meaning, signification

entries.meaning: any terse and pointed observation (esp. moralistic); a maxim, epigram
(grammar) a self-contained group of words, a finished clause, sentence, period
